intro: Erysimum praecox, commonly known as early candytuft, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lobed leaves that are aromatic when crushed. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
